TopicTitle: Rockets uncontrollable, engines gimballing in circle, very small rockets still work fine.

Articles.Content:
Hello, I have encountered a rather odd and game breaking glitch, my rockets are uncontrollable on launch, the engines gimbal around in a circle and I have no control over it. I've launched rockets this big and bigger before and not had a problem, and I haven't added any mods in the meantime, so I am struggling to find what the problem is. Staging still works fine, but even after dropping the 1st stage the upper one just does the exact same thing.

The mods I am running are:

AIES

B9 Procedural Wings

EVE

Chaka Monkey

Community Resource Pack

Cross Feed Enabler

Crowd Sourced Science

Dmagic Science

FASA launch clamps

Firespitter

Interstellar Fuel Switch

FAX

Kerbal Engineer

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

Klockheed Martian Gimbal 

KW Rocketry

Mod Oriented Tech Tree

Module Animate Emissive

RLA Stockalike

Procedural Parts

Procedural Fairings

Tweakscale

Ubio Welding

Vens Stock Revamp.

As you can see none of these are the kinds of mod that limit control of a craft based on anything. I've tested with lots of different engines and it happens with all of them on this particular rocket, and on the last rocket I made, but when I quickly chuck together a pod, fuel tank and engine it works fine and I have control.

I have tried adding control surfaces but they just wobble from side to side and give me no control either.

I have been adding and removing mods and have had no difference in this, finally at my wits end and worried its something glitching with stock. I was wondering if anyone has experienced something similar and if so what was done to fix the problem?

If you need any more information please ask and I shall try my best! I looked in the logs and found nothing that was forthcoming it didn't seem to register anything was going wrong at all but if needs be I can supply logs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T21:00:47Z" title="08/13/2015 09:00  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Squiggsy**

The engine gimbals are drawing circles you say? That is strange. I would recommend that you do upload some logs and then if you get the chance try a fresh stock game.

Does this behavior exist without the engines running? Can you see them just gimballing by themselves on the pad? Does it only do it with SAS on?

Maybe check that your keyboard is not bugging out. Remove it then plug it back in. Because this happened to me last night. Keyboard just shutdown in the middle of a launch and I lost control. Unplugging then plugging it back in brought it back.

Oh, I didn't see. What's Klockheed Martin Gimbal? That'd be my first suspect. Again try a stock install.

> 
> The engine gimbals are drawing circles you say? That is strange. I would recommend that you do upload some logs and then if you get the chance try a fresh stock game.
> Does this behavior exist without the engines running? Can you see them just gimballing by themselves on the pad? Does it only do it with SAS on?
> 
> Maybe check that your keyboard is not bugging out. Remove it then plug it back in. Because this happened to me last night. Keyboard just shutdown in the middle of a launch and I lost control. Unplugging then plugging it back in brought it back.
> 
> Oh, I didn't see. What's Klockheed Martin Gimbal? That'd be my first suspect. Again try a stock install.

 Thats for the fast response! Klockheed Martian Gimbal was my next suspect but control surfaces were bugging out too and I'd had it for ages (it is used by some other mods to give extra gimballing options such as only allowing gimballing in a singular direction) but I am now deleting it and trying again. I forgot to mention in OP that I'd already tried unplugging and replugging my keyboard, wasn't that. I will upload a log in a second once I check everything is still not working.

The engines don't gimbal until activated and don't do it if SAS is deactivated either so I guess it is just the engine doing it to keep the rocket going straight.

I just tried removing Klockheed martian and it's still not working so I'll upload the logs onto pastebin or something now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

AH-HAH! While I was typing this I decided to try changing the staging, if I activate the engines THEN remove the clamps I have control, so it's something to do with the clamps glitching it seems!

still have no idea what is happening, I have had a LOT of problems with clamps, both stock and not, them arriving all over the place, exploding my vessel randomly, all kinds of things, but I have never had this as a glitch until now!

EDIT: Whoops got ahead of myself, it's actually SAS being active that causes the problem, turned on SAS and lost all control again, I have a suspicion it might be a reaction wheel I have since the same one is used on both vessles that had this problem, and I haven't used one on any other crafts, so I shall explore that avenue now.

EDIT: Yep it's either the AIES Reaction Wheel or it's the fact that it was tweakscaled, but I tried tweakscaling a different reaction wheel and didn't have the issue still. Doesn't mean I can confirm it was the part itself because tweakscale seems the more likely culprit, but I will experiment a bit more and try to confirm the problem before updating this to solved and putting my conclusion in the OP incase it happens to anyone else

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T21:09:15Z" title="08/13/2015 09:09  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Squiggsy**

Ah go figure. Yea now that I think about it I remember reading people having issues with AIES reaction wheels.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-1-0-4-AIES-Aerospace-v1-6-0/page117](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-1-0-4-AIES-Aerospace-v1-6-0/page117)

Post number 1167. Sound familiar?

> 
> Ah go figure. Yea now that I think about it I remember reading people having issues with AIES reaction wheels.
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-1-0-4-AIES-Aerospace-v1-6-0/page117](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-1-0-4-AIES-Aerospace-v1-6-0/page117)
> 
> Post number 1167. Sound familiar?

Yep that sounds like exactly the same problem as mine, really can't see how though was looking at the configs for them and its just a straight up modulereactionwheel, very odd that these reaction wheels in particular are having this issue, thanks for you help!
